'Mass surveillance' is the pervasive surveillance of an entire population, or a
substantial fraction thereof.

Mass surveillance has been widely criticized on several grounds such as
violations of privacy rights, illegality, and for preventing political and
social freedoms, which some fear will ultimately lead to a totalitarian state
where political dissent is crushed by COINTELPRO-like programs. Such a state may
also be referred to as an Electronic Police State.
